013package org.apache.juneau;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.BeanMeta.MethodType.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.ThrowableUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConsumerUtils.*;
019
020import java.beans.*;
021import java.io.*;
022import java.lang.reflect.*;
023import java.util.*;
024import java.util.function.*;
025
026import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
030
031/**
032 * Encapsulates all access to the properties of a bean class (like a souped-up {@link java.beans.BeanInfo}).
033 *
034 * <h5 class='topic'>Description</h5>
035 *
036 * Uses introspection to find all the properties associated with this class.  If the {@link Bean @Bean} annotation
037 *    is present on the class, then that information is used to determine the properties on the class.
038 * Otherwise, the {@code BeanInfo} functionality in Java is used to determine the properties on the class.
039 *
040 * <h5 class='topic'>Bean property ordering</h5>
041 *
042 * The order of the properties are as follows:
043 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
044 *    <li>
045 *       If {@link Bean @Bean} annotation is specified on class, then the order is the same as the list of properties
046 *       in the annotation.
047 *    <li>
048 *       If {@link Bean @Bean} annotation is not specified on the class, then the order is based on the following.
049 *       <ul>
050 *          <li>Public fields (same order as {@code Class.getFields()}).
051 *          <li>Properties returned by {@code BeanInfo.getPropertyDescriptors()}.
052 *          <li>Non-standard getters/setters with {@link Beanp @Beanp} annotation defined on them.
053 *       </ul>
054 * </ul>
055 *
056 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
057
058 * </ul>
059 *
060 * @param <T> The class type that this metadata applies to.
061 */
062public class BeanMeta<T> {
063
064   private static final BeanPropertyMeta[] EMPTY_PROPERTIES = {};
065
066   /** The target class type that this meta object describes. */
067   protected final ClassMeta<T> classMeta;
068
069   /** The target class that this meta object describes. */
070   protected final Class<T> c;
071
072   /** The properties on the target class. */
073   protected final Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> properties;
074
075   /** The properties on the target class. */
076   protected final BeanPropertyMeta[] propertyArray;
077
078   /** The hidden properties on the target class. */
079   protected final Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> hiddenProperties;
080
081   /** The getter properties on the target class. */
082   protected final Map<Method,String> getterProps;
083
084   /** The setter properties on the target class. */
085   protected final Map<Method,String> setterProps;
086
087   /** The bean context that created this metadata object. */
088   protected final BeanContext ctx;
089
090   /** Optional bean filter associated with the target class. */
091   protected final BeanFilter beanFilter;
092
093   /** Type variables implemented by this bean. */
094   protected final Map<Class<?>,Class<?>[]> typeVarImpls;
095
096   /** The constructor for this bean. */
097   protected final ConstructorInfo constructor;
098
099   /** For beans with constructors with Beanc annotation, this is the list of constructor arg properties. */
100   protected final String[] constructorArgs;
101
102   // Other fields
103   final String typePropertyName;                         // "_type" property actual name.
104   private final BeanPropertyMeta typeProperty;           // "_type" mock bean property.
105   final BeanPropertyMeta dynaProperty;                   // "extras" property.
106   private final String dictionaryName;                   // The @Bean(typeName) annotation defined on this bean class.
107   final String notABeanReason;                           // Readable string explaining why this class wasn't a bean.
108   final BeanRegistry beanRegistry;
109   final boolean sortProperties;
110   final boolean fluentSetters;
111
112   /**
113    * Constructor.
114    *
115    * @param classMeta The target class.
116    * @param ctx The bean context that created this object.
117    * @param beanFilter Optional bean filter associated with the target class.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
118    * @param pNames Explicit list of property names and order of properties.  If <jk>null</jk>, determine automatically.
119    * @param implClassConstructor The constructor to use if one cannot be found.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
120    */
121   protected BeanMeta(final ClassMeta<T> classMeta, BeanContext ctx, BeanFilter beanFilter, String[] pNames, ConstructorInfo implClassConstructor) {
122      this.classMeta = classMeta;
123      this.ctx = ctx;
124      this.c = classMeta.getInnerClass();
125
126      Builder<T> b = new Builder<>(classMeta, ctx, beanFilter, pNames, implClassConstructor);
127      this.notABeanReason = b.init(this);
128
129      this.beanFilter = beanFilter;
130      this.dictionaryName = b.dictionaryName;
131      this.properties = u(b.properties);
132      this.propertyArray = properties == null ? EMPTY_PROPERTIES : Utils.array(properties.values(), BeanPropertyMeta.class);
133      this.hiddenProperties = u(b.hiddenProperties);
134      this.getterProps = u(b.getterProps);
135      this.setterProps = u(b.setterProps);
136      this.dynaProperty = b.dynaProperty;
137      this.typeVarImpls = u(b.typeVarImpls);
138      this.constructor = b.constructor;
139      this.constructorArgs = b.constructorArgs;
140      this.beanRegistry = b.beanRegistry;
141      this.typePropertyName = b.typePropertyName;
142      this.typeProperty = BeanPropertyMeta.builder(this, typePropertyName).canRead().canWrite().rawMetaType(ctx.string()).beanRegistry(beanRegistry).build();
143      this.sortProperties = b.sortProperties;
144      this.fluentSetters = b.fluentSetters;
145
146      if (sortProperties)
147         Arrays.sort(propertyArray);
148   }
149
150   private static class Builder<T> {
151      ClassMeta<T> classMeta;
152      BeanContext ctx;
153      BeanFilter beanFilter;
154      String[] pNames;
155      Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> properties;
156      Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> hiddenProperties = map();
157      Map<Method,String> getterProps = map();
158      Map<Method,String> setterProps = map();
159      BeanPropertyMeta dynaProperty;
160
161      Map<Class<?>,Class<?>[]> typeVarImpls;
162      ConstructorInfo constructor, implClassConstructor;
163      String[] constructorArgs = {};
164      PropertyNamer propertyNamer;
165      BeanRegistry beanRegistry;
166      String dictionaryName, typePropertyName;
167      boolean sortProperties, fluentSetters;
168
169      Builder(ClassMeta<T> classMeta, BeanContext ctx, BeanFilter beanFilter, String[] pNames, ConstructorInfo implClassConstructor) {
170         this.classMeta = classMeta;
171         this.ctx = ctx;
172         this.beanFilter = beanFilter;
173         this.pNames = pNames;
174         this.implClassConstructor = implClassConstructor;
175      }
176
177      String init(BeanMeta<T> beanMeta) {
178         Class<?> c = classMeta.getInnerClass();
179         ClassInfo ci = classMeta.getInfo();
180
181         try {
182            Visibility
183               conVis = ctx.getBeanConstructorVisibility(),
184               cVis = ctx.getBeanClassVisibility(),
185               mVis = ctx.getBeanMethodVisibility(),
186               fVis = ctx.getBeanFieldVisibility();
187
188            List<Class<?>> bdClasses = list();
189            if (beanFilter != null && beanFilter.getBeanDictionary() != null)
190               CollectionUtils.addAll(bdClasses, beanFilter.getBeanDictionary());
191
192            Value<String> typeName = Value.empty();
193            classMeta.forEachAnnotation(Bean.class, x -> isNotEmpty(x.typeName()), x -> typeName.set(x.typeName()));
194            if (typeName.isPresent())
195               bdClasses.add(classMeta.innerClass);
196            this.beanRegistry = new BeanRegistry(ctx, null, bdClasses.toArray(new Class<?>[bdClasses.size()]));
197
198            Value<String> typePropertyName = Value.empty();
199            classMeta.forEachAnnotation(Bean.class, x -> isNotEmpty(x.typePropertyName()), x -> typePropertyName.set(x.typePropertyName()));
200            this.typePropertyName = typePropertyName.orElseGet(()->ctx.getBeanTypePropertyName());
201
202            fluentSetters = (ctx.isFindFluentSetters() || (beanFilter != null && beanFilter.isFluentSetters()));
203
204            // If @Bean.interfaceClass is specified on the parent class, then we want
205            // to use the properties defined on that class, not the subclass.
206            Class<?> c2 = (beanFilter != null && beanFilter.getInterfaceClass() != null ? beanFilter.getInterfaceClass() : c);
207
208            Class<?> stopClass = (beanFilter != null ? beanFilter.getStopClass() : Object.class);
209            if (stopClass == null)
210               stopClass = Object.class;
211
212            Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta.Builder> normalProps = map();
213
214            boolean hasBean = ci.hasAnnotation(ctx, Bean.class);
215            boolean hasBeanIgnore = ci.hasAnnotation(ctx, BeanIgnore.class);
216
217            /// See if this class matches one the patterns in the exclude-class list.
218            if (ctx.isNotABean(c))
219               return "Class matches exclude-class list";
220
221            if (! hasBean && ! (cVis.isVisible(c.getModifiers()) || c.isAnonymousClass()))
222               return "Class is not public";
223
224            if (hasBeanIgnore)
225               return "Class is annotated with @BeanIgnore";
226
227            // Make sure it's serializable.
228            if (beanFilter == null && ctx.isBeansRequireSerializable() && ! ci.isChildOf(Serializable.class))
229               return "Class is not serializable";
230
231            // Look for @Beanc constructor on public constructors.
232            ci.forEachPublicConstructor(x -> x.hasAnnotation(ctx, Beanc.class), x -> {
233               if (constructor != null)
234                  throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Multiple instances of '@Beanc' found.");
235               constructor = x;
236               constructorArgs = new String[0];
237               ctx.forEachAnnotation(Beanc.class, x.inner(), y -> ! y.properties().isEmpty(), z -> constructorArgs = splita(z.properties()));
238               if (! x.hasNumParams(constructorArgs.length)) {
239                  if (constructorArgs.length != 0)
240                     throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Number of properties defined in '@Beanc' annotation does not match number of parameters in constructor.");
241                  constructorArgs = new String[x.getParamCount()];
242                  IntValue i = IntValue.create();
243                  x.forEachParam(null, pi -> {
244                     String pn = pi.getName();
245                     if (pn == null)
246                        throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Could not find name for parameter #{0} of constructor ''{1}''", i, x.getFullName());
247                     constructorArgs[i.getAndIncrement()] = pn;
248                  });
249               }
250               constructor.setAccessible();
251            });
252
253            // Look for @Beanc on all other constructors.
254            if (constructor == null) {
255               ci.forEachDeclaredConstructor(x -> x.hasAnnotation(ctx, Beanc.class), x -> {
256                  if (constructor != null)
257                     throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Multiple instances of '@Beanc' found.");
258                  constructor = x;
259                  constructorArgs = new String[0];
260                  ctx.forEachAnnotation(Beanc.class, x.inner(), y -> ! y.properties().isEmpty(), z -> constructorArgs = splita(z.properties()));
261                  if (! x.hasNumParams(constructorArgs.length)) {
262                     if (constructorArgs.length != 0)
263                        throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Number of properties defined in '@Beanc' annotation does not match number of parameters in constructor.");
264                     constructorArgs = new String[x.getParamCount()];
265                     IntValue i = IntValue.create();
266                     x.forEachParam(null, y -> {
267                        String pn = y.getName();
268                        if (pn == null)
269                           throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Could not find name for parameter #{0} of constructor ''{1}''", i, x.getFullName());
270                        constructorArgs[i.getAndIncrement()] = pn;
271                     });
272                  }
273                  constructor.setAccessible();
274               });
275            }
276
277            // If this is an interface, look for impl classes defined in the context.
278            if (constructor == null)
279               constructor = implClassConstructor;
280
281            if (constructor == null)
282               constructor = ci.getNoArgConstructor(hasBean ? Visibility.PRIVATE : conVis);
283
284            if (constructor == null && beanFilter == null && ctx.isBeansRequireDefaultConstructor())
285               return "Class does not have the required no-arg constructor";
286
287            if (constructor != null)
288               constructor.setAccessible();
289
290            // Explicitly defined property names in @Bean annotation.
291            Set<String> fixedBeanProps = set();
292            Set<String> bpi = set();
293            Set<String> bpx = set();
294            Set<String> bpro = set();
295            Set<String> bpwo = set();
296
297            Set<String> filterProps = set();  // Names of properties defined in @Bean(properties)
298
299            if (beanFilter != null) {
300
301               Set<String> bfbpi = beanFilter.getProperties();
302
303               filterProps.addAll(bfbpi);
304
305               // Get the 'properties' attribute if specified.
306               if (bpi.isEmpty())
307                  fixedBeanProps.addAll(bfbpi);
308
309               if (beanFilter.getPropertyNamer() != null)
310                  propertyNamer = beanFilter.getPropertyNamer();
311
312               bpro.addAll(beanFilter.getReadOnlyProperties());
313               bpwo.addAll(beanFilter.getWriteOnlyProperties());
314            }
315
316            fixedBeanProps.addAll(bpi);
317
318            if (propertyNamer == null)
319               propertyNamer = ctx.getPropertyNamer();
320
321            // First populate the properties with those specified in the bean annotation to
322            // ensure that ordering first.
323            fixedBeanProps.forEach(x -> normalProps.put(x, BeanPropertyMeta.builder(beanMeta, x)));
324
325            if (ctx.isUseJavaBeanIntrospector()) {
326               BeanInfo bi = null;
327               if (! c2.isInterface())
328                  bi = Introspector.getBeanInfo(c2, stopClass);
329               else
330                  bi = Introspector.getBeanInfo(c2, null);
331               if (bi != null) {
332                  for (PropertyDescriptor pd : bi.getPropertyDescriptors()) {
333                     String name = pd.getName();
334                     if (! normalProps.containsKey(name))
335                        normalProps.put(name, BeanPropertyMeta.builder(beanMeta, name));
336                     normalProps.get(name).setGetter(pd.getReadMethod()).setSetter(pd.getWriteMethod());
337                  }
338               }
339
340            } else /* Use 'better' introspection */ {
341
342               findBeanFields(ctx, c2, stopClass, fVis).forEach(x -> {
343                  String name = findPropertyName(x);
344                  if (name != null) {
345                     if (! normalProps.containsKey(name))
346                        normalProps.put(name, BeanPropertyMeta.builder(beanMeta, name));
347                     normalProps.get(name).setField(x);
348                  }
349               });
350
351               List<BeanMethod> bms = findBeanMethods(ctx, c2, stopClass, mVis, propertyNamer, fluentSetters);
352
353               // Iterate through all the getters.
354               bms.forEach(x -> {
355                  String pn = x.propertyName;
356                  Method m = x.method;
357                  if (! normalProps.containsKey(pn))
358                     normalProps.put(pn, new BeanPropertyMeta.Builder(beanMeta, pn));
359                  BeanPropertyMeta.Builder bpm = normalProps.get(pn);
360                  if (x.methodType == GETTER) {
361                     // Two getters.  Pick the best.
362                     if (bpm.getter != null) {
363
364                        if (! ctx.hasAnnotation(Beanp.class, m) && ctx.hasAnnotation(Beanp.class, bpm.getter))
365                           m = bpm.getter;  // @Beanp annotated method takes precedence.
366
367                        else if (m.getName().startsWith("is") && bpm.getter.getName().startsWith("get"))
368                           m = bpm.getter;  // getX() overrides isX().
369                     }
370                     bpm.setGetter(m);
371                  }
372               });
373
374               // Now iterate through all the setters.
375               bms.forEach(x -> {
376                  if (x.methodType == SETTER) {
377                     BeanPropertyMeta.Builder bpm = normalProps.get(x.propertyName);
378                     if (x.matchesPropertyType(bpm))
379                        bpm.setSetter(x.method);
380                  }
381               });
382
383               // Now iterate through all the extraKeys.
384               bms.forEach(x -> {
385                  if (x.methodType == EXTRAKEYS) {
386                     BeanPropertyMeta.Builder bpm = normalProps.get(x.propertyName);
387                     bpm.setExtraKeys(x.method);
388                  }
389               });
390            }
391
392            typeVarImpls = map();
393            findTypeVarImpls(c, typeVarImpls);
394            if (typeVarImpls.isEmpty())
395               typeVarImpls = null;
396
397            // Eliminate invalid properties, and set the contents of getterProps and setterProps.
398            for (Iterator<BeanPropertyMeta.Builder> i = normalProps.values().iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
399               BeanPropertyMeta.Builder p = i.next();
400               try {
401                  if (p.field == null)
402                     p.setInnerField(findInnerBeanField(ctx, c, stopClass, p.name));
403
404                  if (p.validate(ctx, beanRegistry, typeVarImpls, bpro, bpwo)) {
405
406                     if (p.getter != null)
407                        getterProps.put(p.getter, p.name);
408
409                     if (p.setter != null)
410                        setterProps.put(p.setter, p.name);
411
412                  } else {
413                     i.remove();
414                  }
415               } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
416                  throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, e.getLocalizedMessage());
417               }
418            }
419
420            // Check for missing properties.
421            fixedBeanProps.forEach(x -> {
422               if (! normalProps.containsKey(x))
423                  throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "The property ''{0}'' was defined on the @Bean(properties=X) annotation of class ''{1}'' but was not found on the class definition.", x, ci.getSimpleName());
424            });
425
426            // Mark constructor arg properties.
427            for (String fp : constructorArgs) {
428               BeanPropertyMeta.Builder m = normalProps.get(fp);
429               if (m == null)
430                  throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "The property ''{0}'' was defined on the @Beanc(properties=X) annotation but was not found on the class definition.", fp);
431               m.setAsConstructorArg();
432            }
433
434            // Make sure at least one property was found.
435            if (beanFilter == null && ctx.isBeansRequireSomeProperties() && normalProps.isEmpty())
436               return "No properties detected on bean class";
437
438            sortProperties = (ctx.isSortProperties() || (beanFilter != null && beanFilter.isSortProperties())) && fixedBeanProps.isEmpty();
439
440            properties = sortProperties ? CollectionUtils.sortedMap() : map();
441
442            if (beanFilter != null && beanFilter.getTypeName() != null)
443               dictionaryName = beanFilter.getTypeName();
444            if (dictionaryName == null)
445               dictionaryName = findDictionaryName(this.classMeta);
446
447            normalProps.forEach((k,v) -> {
448               BeanPropertyMeta pMeta = v.build();
449               if (pMeta.isDyna())
450                  dynaProperty = pMeta;
451               properties.put(k, pMeta);
452            });
453
454            // If a beanFilter is defined, look for inclusion and exclusion lists.
455            if (beanFilter != null) {
456
457               // Eliminated excluded properties if BeanFilter.excludeKeys is specified.
458               Set<String> bfbpi = beanFilter.getProperties();
459               Set<String> bfbpx = beanFilter.getExcludeProperties();
460
461               if (bpi.isEmpty() && ! bfbpi.isEmpty()) {
462                  // Only include specified properties if BeanFilter.includeKeys is specified.
463                  // Note that the order must match includeKeys.
464                  Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> properties2 = map();
465                  bfbpi.forEach(x -> {
466                     if (properties.containsKey(x))
467                        properties2.put(x, properties.remove(x));
468                  });
469                  hiddenProperties.putAll(properties);
470                  properties = properties2;
471               }
472               if (bpx.isEmpty() && ! bfbpx.isEmpty()) {
473                  bfbpx.forEach(x -> hiddenProperties.put(x, properties.remove(x)));
474               }
475            }
476
477            if (! bpi.isEmpty()) {
478               Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> properties2 = map();
479               bpi.forEach(x -> {
480                  if (properties.containsKey(x))
481                     properties2.put(x, properties.remove(x));
482               });
483               hiddenProperties.putAll(properties);
484               properties = properties2;
485            }
486
487            bpx.forEach(x -> hiddenProperties.put(x, properties.remove(x)));
488
489            if (pNames != null) {
490               Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> properties2 = map();
491               for (String k : pNames) {
492                  if (properties.containsKey(k))
493                     properties2.put(k, properties.get(k));
494                  else
495                     hiddenProperties.put(k, properties.get(k));
496               }
497               properties = properties2;
498            }
499
500         } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
501            throw e;
502         } catch (Exception e) {
503            return "Exception:  " + getStackTrace(e);
504         }
505
506         return null;
507      }
508
509      private String findDictionaryName(ClassMeta<?> cm) {
510         BeanRegistry br = cm.getBeanRegistry();
511         if (br != null) {
512            String s = br.getTypeName(this.classMeta);
513            if (s != null)
514               return s;
515         }
516         Class<?> pcm = cm.innerClass.getSuperclass();
517         if (pcm != null) {
518            String s = findDictionaryName(ctx.getClassMeta(pcm));
519            if (s != null)
520               return s;
521         }
522         for (Class<?> icm : cm.innerClass.getInterfaces()) {
523            String s = findDictionaryName(ctx.getClassMeta(icm));
524            if (s != null)
525               return s;
526         }
527         return null;
528      }
529
530      /*
531       * Returns the property name of the specified field if it's a valid property.
532       * Returns null if the field isn't a valid property.
533       */
534      private String findPropertyName(Field f) {
535         List<Beanp> lp = list();
536         List<Name> ln = list();
537         ctx.forEachAnnotation(Beanp.class, f, x -> true, x -> lp.add(x));
538         ctx.forEachAnnotation(Name.class, f, x -> true, x -> ln.add(x));
539         String name = bpName(lp, ln);
540         if (isNotEmpty(name))
541            return name;
542         return propertyNamer.getPropertyName(f.getName());
543      }
544   }
545
546   /**
547    * Returns the {@link ClassMeta} of this bean.
548    *
549    * @return The {@link ClassMeta} of this bean.
550    */
551   public final ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta() {
552      return classMeta;
553   }
554
555   /**
556    * Returns the dictionary name for this bean as defined through the {@link Bean#typeName() @Bean(typeName)} annotation.
557    *
558    * @return The dictionary name for this bean, or <jk>null</jk> if it has no dictionary name defined.
559    */
560   public final String getDictionaryName() {
561      return dictionaryName;
562   }
563
564   /**
565    * Returns a mock bean property that resolves to the name <js>"_type"</js> and whose value always resolves to the
566    * dictionary name of the bean.
567    *
568    * @return The type name property.
569    */
570   public final BeanPropertyMeta getTypeProperty() {
571      return typeProperty;
572   }
573
574   /**
575    * Possible property method types.
576    */
577   enum MethodType {
578      UNKNOWN,
579      GETTER,
580      SETTER,
581      EXTRAKEYS;
582   }
583
584   /*
585    * Temporary getter/setter method struct.
586    */
587   private static class BeanMethod {
588      String propertyName;
589      MethodType methodType;
590      Method method;
591      ClassInfo type;
592
593      BeanMethod(String propertyName, MethodType type, Method method) {
594         this.propertyName = propertyName;
595         this.methodType = type;
596         this.method = method;
597         if (type == MethodType.SETTER)
598            this.type = ClassInfo.of(method.getParameterTypes()[0]);
599         else
600            this.type = ClassInfo.of(method.getReturnType());
601      }
602
603      /*
604       * Returns true if this method matches the class type of the specified property.
605       * Only meant to be used for setters.
606       */
607      boolean matchesPropertyType(BeanPropertyMeta.Builder b) {
608         if (b == null)
609            return false;
610
611         // Don't do further validation if this is the "*" bean property.
612         if ("*".equals(b.name))
613            return true;
614
615         // Get the bean property type from the getter/field.
616         Class<?> pt = null;
617         if (b.getter != null)
618            pt = b.getter.getReturnType();
619         else if (b.field != null)
620            pt = b.field.getType();
621
622         // Matches if only a setter is defined.
623         if (pt == null)
624            return true;
625
626         // Doesn't match if not same type or super type as getter/field.
627         if (! type.isParentOf(pt))
628            return false;
629
630         // If a setter was previously set, only use this setter if it's a closer
631         // match (e.g. prev type is a superclass of this type).
632         if (b.setter == null)
633            return true;
634
635         return type.isStrictChildOf(b.setter.getParameterTypes()[0]);
636      }
637
638      @Override /* Object */
639      public String toString() {
640         return method.toString();
641      }
642   }
643
644   /*
645    * Find all the bean methods on this class.
646    *
647    * @param c The transformed class.
648    * @param stopClass Don't look above this class in the hierarchy.
649    * @param v The minimum method visibility.
650    * @param fixedBeanProps Only include methods whose properties are in this list.
651    * @param pn Use this property namer to determine property names from the method names.
652    */
653   static final List<BeanMethod> findBeanMethods(BeanContext ctx, Class<?> c, Class<?> stopClass, Visibility v, PropertyNamer pn, boolean fluentSetters) {
654      List<BeanMethod> l = new LinkedList<>();
655
656      forEachClass(ClassInfo.of(c), stopClass, c2 -> {
657         for (MethodInfo m : c2.getDeclaredMethods()) {
658            if (m.isStatic() || m.isBridge() || m.getParamCount() > 2 || m.hasAnnotation(ctx, BeanIgnore.class))
659               continue;
660            Transient t = m.getAnnotation(ctx, Transient.class);
661            if (t != null && t.value())
662               continue;
663
664            List<Beanp> lp = list();
665            List<Name> ln = list();
666            ctx.forEachAnnotation(Beanp.class, m.inner(), x -> true, x -> lp.add(x));
667            ctx.forEachAnnotation(Name.class, m.inner(), x -> true, x -> ln.add(x));
668            if (! (m.isVisible(v) || isNotEmpty(lp) || isNotEmpty(ln)))
669               continue;
670
671            String n = m.getSimpleName();
672
673            List<ClassInfo> pt = m.getParamTypes();
674            ClassInfo rt = m.getReturnType();
675            MethodType methodType = UNKNOWN;
676            String bpName = bpName(lp, ln);
677
678            if (pt.isEmpty()) {
679               if ("*".equals(bpName)) {
680                  if (rt.isChildOf(Collection.class)) {
681                     methodType = EXTRAKEYS;
682                  } else if (rt.isChildOf(Map.class)) {
683                     methodType = GETTER;
684                  }
685                  n = bpName;
686               } else if (n.startsWith("get") && (! rt.is(Void.TYPE))) {
687                  methodType = GETTER;
688                  n = n.substring(3);
689               } else if (n.startsWith("is") && (rt.is(Boolean.TYPE) || rt.is(Boolean.class))) {
690                  methodType = GETTER;
691                  n = n.substring(2);
692               } else if (bpName != null) {
693                  methodType = GETTER;
694                  if (bpName.isEmpty()) {
695                     if (n.startsWith("get"))
696                        n = n.substring(3);
697                     else if (n.startsWith("is"))
698                        n = n.substring(2);
699                     bpName = n;
700                  } else {
701                     n = bpName;
702                  }
703               }
704            } else if (pt.size() == 1) {
705               if ("*".equals(bpName)) {
706                  if (pt.get(0).isChildOf(Map.class)) {
707                     methodType = SETTER;
708                     n = bpName;
709                  } else if (pt.get(0).is(String.class)) {
710                     methodType = GETTER;
711                     n = bpName;
712                  }
713               } else if (n.startsWith("set") && (rt.isParentOf(c) || rt.is(Void.TYPE))) {
714                  methodType = SETTER;
715                  n = n.substring(3);
716               } else if (n.startsWith("with") && (rt.isParentOf(c))) {
717                  methodType = SETTER;
718                  n = n.substring(4);
719               } else if (bpName != null) {
720                  methodType = SETTER;
721                  if (bpName.isEmpty()) {
722                     if (n.startsWith("set"))
723                        n = n.substring(3);
724                     bpName = n;
725                  } else {
726                     n = bpName;
727                  }
728               } else if (fluentSetters && rt.isParentOf(c)) {
729                  methodType = SETTER;
730               }
731            } else if (pt.size() == 2) {
732               if ("*".equals(bpName) && pt.get(0).is(String.class)) {
733                  if (n.startsWith("set") && (rt.isParentOf(c) || rt.is(Void.TYPE))) {
734                     methodType = SETTER;
735                  } else {
736                     methodType = GETTER;
737                  }
738                  n = bpName;
739               }
740            }
741            n = pn.getPropertyName(n);
742
743            if ("*".equals(bpName) && methodType == UNKNOWN)
744               throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Found @Beanp(\"*\") but could not determine method type on method ''{0}''.", m.getSimpleName());
745
746            if (methodType != UNKNOWN) {
747               if (bpName != null && ! bpName.isEmpty())
748                  n = bpName;
749               if (n != null)
750                  l.add(new BeanMethod(n, methodType, m.inner()));
751            }
752         }
753      });
754      return l;
755   }
756
757   static final Collection<Field> findBeanFields(BeanContext ctx, Class<?> c, Class<?> stopClass, Visibility v) {
758      List<Field> l = new LinkedList<>();
759      boolean noIgnoreTransients = ! ctx.isIgnoreTransientFields();
760      forEachClass(ClassInfo.of(c), stopClass, c2 -> {
761         c2.forEachDeclaredField(
762            x -> x.isNotStatic()
763            && (x.isNotTransient() || noIgnoreTransients)
764            && (x.hasNoAnnotation(Transient.class) || noIgnoreTransients)
765            && x.hasNoAnnotation(ctx, BeanIgnore.class)
766            && (v.isVisible(x.inner()) || x.hasAnnotation(ctx, Beanp.class)),
767            x -> l.add(x.inner())
768         );
769      });
770      return l;
771   }
772
773   static final Field findInnerBeanField(BeanContext ctx, Class<?> c, Class<?> stopClass, String name) {
774      boolean noIgnoreTransients = ! ctx.isIgnoreTransientFields();
775      Value<Field> value = Value.empty();
776      forEachClass(ClassInfo.of(c), stopClass, c2 -> {
777         FieldInfo f = c2.getDeclaredField(
778            x -> x.isNotStatic()
779            && (x.isNotTransient() || noIgnoreTransients)
780            && (x.hasNoAnnotation(Transient.class) || noIgnoreTransients)
781            && x.hasNoAnnotation(ctx, BeanIgnore.class)
782            && x.hasName(name)
783         );
784         if (f != null)
785            value.set(f.inner());
786      });
787      return value.get();
788   }
789
790// private static List<ClassInfo> findClasses(Class<?> c, Class<?> stopClass) {
791//    LinkedList<ClassInfo> l = new LinkedList<>();
792//    forEachClass(ClassInfo.of(c), stopClass, x -> l.add(x));
793//    return l;
794// }
795
796   private static void forEachClass(ClassInfo c, Class<?> stopClass, Consumer<ClassInfo> consumer) {
797      ClassInfo sc = c.getSuperclass();
798      if (sc != null && ! sc.is(stopClass))
799         forEachClass(sc, stopClass, consumer);
800      c.getInterfaces().forEach(x -> forEachClass(x, stopClass, consumer));
801      consumer.accept(c);
802   }
803
804   /**
805    * Returns the metadata on all properties associated with this bean.
806    *
807    * @return Metadata on all properties associated with this bean.
808    */
809   public Collection<BeanPropertyMeta> getPropertyMetas() {
810      return u(alist(propertyArray));
811   }
812
813   /**
814    * Performs an action on all matching properties.
815    *
816    * @param filter The filter to apply.
817    * @param action The action to apply.
818    */
819   public void forEachProperty(Predicate<BeanPropertyMeta> filter, Consumer<BeanPropertyMeta> action) {
820      for (BeanPropertyMeta x : propertyArray)
821         if (test(filter, x))
822            action.accept(x);
823   }
824
825   /**
826    * Performs a function on the first property that matches the specified filter.
827    *
828    * @param <T2> The type to convert the property to.
829    * @param filter The filter to apply.
830    * @param function The function to apply to the matching property.
831    * @return The result of the function.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
832    */
833   public <T2> Optional<T2> firstProperty(Predicate<BeanPropertyMeta> filter, Function<BeanPropertyMeta,T2> function) {
834      for (BeanPropertyMeta x : propertyArray)
835         if (test(filter, x))
836            return Optional.ofNullable(function.apply(x));
837      return Optional.empty();
838   }
839
840   /**
841    * Returns metadata about the specified property.
842    *
843    * @param name The name of the property on this bean.
844    * @return The metadata about the property, or <jk>null</jk> if no such property exists on this bean.
845    */
846   public BeanPropertyMeta getPropertyMeta(String name) {
847      BeanPropertyMeta bpm = properties.get(name);
848      if (bpm == null)
849         bpm = hiddenProperties.get(name);
850      if (bpm == null)
851         bpm = dynaProperty;
852      return bpm;
853   }
854
855   /**
856    * Creates a new instance of this bean.
857    *
858    * @param outer The outer object if bean class is a non-static inner member class.
859    * @return A new instance of this bean if possible, or <jk>null</jk> if not.
860    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
861    */
862   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
863   protected T newBean(Object outer) throws ExecutableException {
864      if (classMeta.isMemberClass()) {
865         if (constructor != null)
866            return constructor.<T>invoke(outer);
867      } else {
868         if (constructor != null)
869            return constructor.<T>invoke();
870         InvocationHandler h = classMeta.getProxyInvocationHandler();
871         if (h != null) {
872            ClassLoader cl = classMeta.innerClass.getClassLoader();
873            return (T)Proxy.newProxyInstance(cl, new Class[] { classMeta.innerClass, java.io.Serializable.class }, h);
874         }
875      }
876      return null;
877   }
878
879   /**
880    * Recursively determines the classes represented by parameterized types in the class hierarchy of the specified
881    * type, and puts the results in the specified map.
882    *
883    * <p>
884    * For example, given the following classes...
885    * <p class='bjava'>
886    *    <jk>public static class</jk> BeanA&lt;T&gt; {
887    *       <jk>public</jk> T <jf>x</jf>;
888    *    }
889    *    <jk>public static class</jk> BeanB <jk>extends</jk> BeanA&lt;Integer> {...}
890    * </p>
891    * <p>
892    *    ...calling this method on {@code BeanB.class} will load the following data into {@code m} indicating
893    *    that the {@code T} parameter on the BeanA class is implemented with an {@code Integer}:
894    * <p class='bcode'>
895    *    {BeanA.class:[Integer.class]}
896    * </p>
897    *
898    * <p>
899    * TODO:  This code doesn't currently properly handle the following situation:
900    * <p class='bjava'>
901    *    <jk>public static class</jk> BeanB&lt;T <jk>extends</jk> Number&gt; <jk>extends</jk> BeanA&lt;>;
902    *    <jk>public static class</jk> BeanC <jk>extends</jk> BeanB&lt;Integer>;
903    * </p>
904    *
905    * <p>
906    * When called on {@code BeanC}, the variable will be detected as a {@code Number}, not an {@code Integer}.
907    * If anyone can figure out a better way of doing this, please do so!
908    *
909    * @param t The type we're recursing.
910    * @param m Where the results are loaded.
911    */
912   static final void findTypeVarImpls(Type t, Map<Class<?>,Class<?>[]> m) {
913      if (t instanceof Class) {
914         Class<?> c = (Class<?>)t;
915         findTypeVarImpls(c.getGenericSuperclass(), m);
916         for (Type ci : c.getGenericInterfaces())
917            findTypeVarImpls(ci, m);
918      } else if (t instanceof ParameterizedType) {
919         ParameterizedType pt = (ParameterizedType)t;
920         Type rt = pt.getRawType();
921         if (rt instanceof Class) {
922            Type[] gImpls = pt.getActualTypeArguments();
923            Class<?>[] gTypes = new Class[gImpls.length];
924            for (int i = 0; i < gImpls.length; i++) {
925               Type gt = gImpls[i];
926               if (gt instanceof Class)
927                  gTypes[i] = (Class<?>)gt;
928               else if (gt instanceof TypeVariable) {
929                  TypeVariable<?> tv = (TypeVariable<?>)gt;
930                  for (Type upperBound : tv.getBounds())
931                     if (upperBound instanceof Class)
932                        gTypes[i] = (Class<?>)upperBound;
933               }
934            }
935            m.put((Class<?>)rt, gTypes);
936            findTypeVarImpls(pt.getRawType(), m);
937         }
938      }
939   }
940
941   /**
942    * Property read interceptor.
943    *
944    * <p>
945    * Called immediately after calling the getter to allow the value to be overridden.
946    *
947    * @param bean The bean from which the property was read.
948    * @param name The property name.
949    * @param value The value just extracted from calling the bean getter.
950    * @return The value to serialize.  Default is just to return the existing value.
951    */
952   public Object onReadProperty(Object bean, String name, Object value) {
953      return beanFilter == null ? value : beanFilter.readProperty(bean, name, value);
954   }
955
956   /**
957    * Property write interceptor.
958    *
959    * <p>
960    * Called immediately before calling theh setter to allow value to be overwridden.
961    *
962    * @param bean The bean from which the property was read.
963    * @param name The property name.
964    * @param value The value just parsed.
965    * @return The value to serialize.  Default is just to return the existing value.
966    */
967   public Object onWriteProperty(Object bean, String name, Object value) {
968      return beanFilter == null ? value : beanFilter.writeProperty(bean, name, value);
969   }
970
971   static final String bpName(List<Beanp> p, List<Name> n) {
972      if (p.isEmpty() && n.isEmpty())
973         return null;
974      if (! n.isEmpty())
975         return CollectionUtils.last(n).value();
976
977      Value<String> name = Value.of(p.isEmpty() ? null : "");
978      p.forEach(x -> {
979         if (! x.value().isEmpty())
980            name.set(x.value());
981         if (! x.name().isEmpty())
982            name.set(x.name());
983      });
984
985      return name.orElse(null);
986   }
987
988   @Override /* Object */
989   public String toString() {
990      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(c.getName());
991      sb.append(" {\n");
992      for (BeanPropertyMeta pm : propertyArray)
993         sb.append('\t').append(pm.toString()).append(",\n");
994      sb.append('}');
995      return sb.toString();
996   }
997
998   @Override /* Object */
999   public int hashCode() {
1000      return classMeta.hashCode();
1001   }
1002
1003   @Override /* Object */
1004   public boolean equals(Object o) {
1005      return (o instanceof BeanMeta) && Utils.eq(this, (BeanMeta<?>)o, (x,y)->Utils.eq(x.classMeta, y.classMeta));
1006   }
1007}
